page.title: 13CHANGING TIMES, TORTHORWALD
page.content: {ROADS AND TRANSPORT 1915_85} Roads were just rough metal and broken stones. Steam rollers ran over the road to flatten it. Men used to knap (break) stones up at Kirkland. There is still a hole there. There were very few cars then. Farmers only had cars. Some people used a horse and cart. Now a lot of people have cars. {Church 1915_85} Every Sunday the church was packed out and all the farmers were there. Now they are lucky to get 30 people. {Shop 1915_85} The shop is much the same, but it is no longer a Post Office. Children did not buy many sweets, as they could not afford them. Most of us get about Â£2 to spent on sweets weekly.
